name: Hotel Continental

reviews.title: below midrange
reviews.text: The hotel was recommended by the taxi driver who took us from the bus station.

reviews.title: great service
reviews.text: The receptionist might have thought that we were backpackers, as he gave us a standard room, without mentioning other possibilities. The price of 85 MYR (deposit of 150) was fair, but the room was extremely shabby, and the bathroom was a disaster.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I first stayed in this hotel 9 years ago and loved it then. We returned for a night on our way through Saigon and it is even more beautiful now that it has been renovated, it has kept all the charm and elegance of it's glorious past and the rooms are gorgeous. Breakfast is wonderful, great choice and beautiful courtyard to dine in if you wish. We paid approx $85 US a night, expensive for Saigon I suppose, but worth every cent.
reviews.title: Elegant, My Favourite Hotel in Vietnam

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were looking forward to our stay here. It was our splash out last night in Saigon. Something to do with its romantic history and Graham Greene’s The Quiet American. Well that was the theory anyway...
reviews.title: Great, but don't get Hotel massage

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled with friends
reviews.text: We liked the look and feel of the hotel and was glad it hadn’t been highly renovated. The first floor lobby reminded us of a horror movie set in an old hospital. However the rooms were massive and beautifully fitted out in lacquered furniture with a sweet little sitting room and French doors leading onto a balcony that overlooked the back of the Opera House. The bathroom was a bit 1960’s but we didn’t mind - it added to the faded glory of this place. And the buffet breakfast in the courtyard was excellent.
reviews.title: Go colonial

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Objectively when compared to over places in Vietnam this place is probably not worth $100 a night but we still enjoyed the experience.
reviews.title: Need major renovation!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff were friendly but their English was very sparse and at times it was hard to get across a basic request. which was surprsiing for such a legendary Hotel.
reviews.title: Very bad service at this grand old lady in Saigon

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were looking for somewhere to stay on route from Bavaria to Provence. Switzerland was ridiculously expensive so we settled for a stop in Evian. The weather was atrocious and the satnav kept directing us down a street that we couldn't drive down - but this issue was acknowledged by the owners. Once inside and up in our room our spirits lifted. Our room had a lot of character and was comfortable. A small-ish bathroom was the only downside. The location was good too and there were a lot of restaurants a short dash under an umbrella away! For the price, you really can't fault it.
reviews.title: Great character and for the price, you can't fault it

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: Although we stayed only one night the host, Michael Coleman, was incredible, helpful, full of useful information, he gave us maps and showed us where to go.
reviews.title: Fabulous host in a beautiful hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: We had a triple room, the beds were really comfortable, the room decorated in a beautiful way and the bathroom was clean, with plenty of towels and toilettries.
reviews.title: Beautifully decorated rooms & friendly owners

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: In the morning we had a typical French hotel breakfast in a delighful dining room.
reviews.title: Charming and good value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Sorry we weren't staying longer - a real gem
reviews.title: Highly recommended!
Not pleased - it was a bit creepy.
reviews.text: We stayed there for 1 night, the final leg of our Vietnam trip. Truth be told, I was excited to stay there cause I had walked that route plenty of times and I must say the architecture from the outside is pretty great. The lobby was nice and we even got an upgrade to a deluxe room but when we got to the 1st floor corridor, I knew it wasn't going to be a fun hotel. (1) the corridors reminded me of old hospitals in the Philippines. Fine, the hotel has been around since 1880 but I it would be better to change the ashtrays to newer ones or make the lighting more bright. (2) the room had tacky light fixtures and furniture. (3) we got 2 single beds instead of the originally requested King/queen bed (4) tiles were a little too freaky for me (5) carpet was a bit damp when we got in (6) the breakfast wasn't good at all and there were fruit flies on the fruit and other food that were served without covers and (7) the overall feel was just too weird and (8) the room was noisy cause we were across the street. A plus side would be the bellboys. They were very nice and accomodating and they didn't let the taxi drivers dupe us. 1 of the reception girls was useless but the other one was quite nice. Overall, no to Continental, HCM. We didn't get value for our money.

reviews.title: in the middle of HCMC with a great tradition
reviews.text: We arrived after a long journey from Switzerland. The hotel shows some signes of communist style. But the rooms are very large, the beds are very comfortable and the service was good. We ha d early dinner within walking distance. The hotel is right by the street and to some extend noisy - but what to you expect in a city with a population of 8 mio. On the night we stayed there were three weddings taking place that were fun to watch for a while. Eventhough the celebrations were quite noisy, we slept very well considering we had a 18 hours journey in our bones. And then we enjoyed a great breakfast.

reviews.title: Great location in colonial feel.
reviews.text: Great location but not the most modern hotel in the area. Traffic noise did get a bit too much. Seems to be a very popular place for weddings, we were there for 4 nights and there was at least one wedding a night (had 3 weddings in one night on a saturday!). Huge rooms - we had a suite and there was a sitting room as well. Could do with a bit of renovation/updating but overall still a very nice hotel. Staff were good. Breakfast was average.

reviews.title: 5 star on a 3 star budget with position, position, position
reviews.text: We booked and paid for this hotel from Australia, so didn't know what to expect. We booked two oriental suites one for us and one for the kids (teenagers). The suites were roomy, the beds comfortable, the breakfast excellent, the minibar cheap, the service fantastic. The only thing I can fault was that the rooms smelt a bit damp or mouldy - however, I noticed this in a few places in Saigon likely due to the humidity. It was better if we opened the windows each morning before we went out.

reviews.title: Stay a night for the history and then go somewhere else
reviews.text: Also a little noisy - given it's position - but what a position!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013
reviews.text: Perfect location next door to the Opera House and a short walk to just about anything you might want to see in Saigon. Rooms are very large and comfortable although the bathroom in our deluxe room was a bit dated. Included breakfast was ok but with a somewhat limited selection. Overall a positive experience. Much better than some of the newer hotels with no character.
reviews.title: Well located with a bit of soul

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The Hotel Continental is perhaps the most famous hotel in Vietnam owing to the author Graham Greene having written The Quiet American while staying in one of it's classical suites. Located in the Center of DIstrict One facing the Opera House, it's location is the BEST hotel for enjoying the festivities of the Lunar New Year. From exceptional cusine to sipping cool drinks on the street-side lounges and watching the TET holiday parades and floral displays. The rooms are tastefully decorated, and we found the Oriental Suites to have exceptional views of the Opera House or garden areas. The breakfast buffet was the best buffet we experienced in 34 days of traveling throughout Vietnam, Thailand, and Cambodia. If you want classical decor, history, and great value for your money, you can't go wrong with the Continental. If you want US or European style glitz for up to twice the costs - go to the Marriott or Majestic or Park Hyatt. Of them all that I have stayed in, it is the Continental I will be returning to in the future.
reviews.title: TET Spectacular

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Our 2 week vacation to Vietnam started with a 2 night stay at the Hotel Continental HCMC. It was perfect in every way. Although not inexpensive by Vietnam standards it was full value. The hotel is attractive and the rooms are ample size. The service was very friendly and efficient. The location was perfect with our balcony facing the famous Opera House. Unfortunately a big tree blocked the view. The buffet breakfast which is included in the price was the best anywhere we had been in Vietnam. We give this hotel top marks.
reviews.title: Really nice hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013
reviews.text: Great hotel in a fantastic location. Rooms are large and well appointed with air conditioning and satellite tv.
reviews.title: Old World Charm

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled on business
reviews.text: Buffet breakfast was OK, convinced the bacon gave me an upset tum but didn't let that spoil my trip.
reviews.title: Located in the heart of the city to serve you always!
Graceful old lady, shackled down by communism
reviews.text: We stayed here for a long w/e in December, and enjoyed it. You have to remember, this is Saigon and not Singapore, so things work differently.

reviews.title: Great Value
reviews.text: Earlier comments here about the 'soviet style' bathrooms are not far wrong, but you should accept that not so long ago, all hotels were like that throughout. You'd go out for the day, and the police would come in your room and go through all your stuff. Maybe they still do.

reviews.title: great location, good value, nice hotel
reviews.text: So this is not a standard destination, even if you spend your whole time on Dong Khoi and try and kid yourself it's not an impoverished hardcore communist country, it is.

reviews.title: Classic old hotel, service a bit spotty
reviews.text: The architecture is elegant. The lobby is not. Clearly it was 'remodelled/taken away at some point. Staff are pretty good, though one or two on front desk seemed to struggle with pretty basic English.

reviews.title: For city centre, it has to be the hotel continental
reviews.text: Breakfast was ok, better than you'd get in Cuba.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were picked up at the airport on our arrival at Ho Chi Minh which I would recommend. The hotel is very grand in external appearance and is adjacent to the Opera House, we were upgraded to a Junior Suite upon our arrival which was huge with a lovely bowl of fresh fruit, balcony, wireless internet, and a hard bed which we found the norm in Vietnam. The staff were efficient and friendly and breakfast was plentiful and very nice in the courtyard. Pre dinner drinks in the courtyard were nice and reasonably priced, and a little interesting ............ tiger beer served in a wine glass. Dinner at the Lemongrass restaurant and drinks at the rooftop bar of the Rex Hotel is highly recommended. The only downside was the Earth Hour celebrations outside of the Opera House which started with a full on drum session at 6am which continued into the small hours ............. not the hotels fault though of course.
reviews.title: Lovely old hotel, great location, massive rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Hotel Continental for 2 nights- our plane arrived around midnight and the arranged transport to the hotel was worth the extra money. Our room was huge and quiet, but as in previous reviews the room decor felt a little dated, but everything appeared to be recently redone. Bathroom was huge and nice. The courtyard for breakfast was great. The location is great- we could walk to all of the other big hotels for drinks at their rooftop bars. I believe our rate was about $75USD a night, which was a lot less than the other well known hotels in the area.
reviews.title: great location, affordable

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I can sum up this hotel in one word: DUMP! However, I must write 50 words so here goes. Even though my partner and I were upgraded to a suite, we were majorly disappointed. To get to our room we had to walk through a crumbling hallway where it appeared someone had taken a sledge hammer to the walls. The room itself was as clean as you could make a room that hadn't been updated since God knows when. (There was tacky red velvet on the walls reminiscent of the 70s.) Construction and traffic noise from outside filtered into the room and there was no hot water. I could go on but until this hotel is gutted and completed overhauled I would not recommend staying here unless you could get a room for under $20 US.
reviews.title: Yikes!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Lured by Graham Green's novel and love of colonial architecture. Stayed one night on 6/2 booked directly with hotel website, they offered an excellent deal $US83 per night including breakfast. I was enchanted and enjoyed our brief visit. It is elegant and has the best location in Saigon. We had a very large room overlooking the Opera House.Yes it is a little faded; but it is part of its charm. Breakfast is average and staff are stuffy ( enjoyed that too). I am happy to recommend this hotel.
reviews.title: Satisfied

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here 3 nights at the start of our Indochina trip then 1 more on the way back. Both times we had spacious rooms with high ceilings. Found the beds comfortable. We liked the breakfasts, out in the large inner courtyard and the staff were always helpful. The location is perfect. Of course there's no pool but on our last day we paid to use the lovely pool at the Park Hyatt next door.
reviews.title: Well located, spacious

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled with friends
reviews.text: We were looking for a bargain hotel in a central location and this hotel absoluitely fit the bill. Owned and run by an American/French family, they could not do enough to make us feel welcome and comfortable.
reviews.title: Excellent value, comfotable and convenient

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: The hotel is on a main shopping street that for most of the day is pedestrian only. It is just a shhort walk top the casino andlake front and restaurants within a shiort walk abound.
reviews.title: This is a gem of a hotel which we were delighted to discover

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Altogether a great find and at a great price.
reviews.title: It was like being invited into a welcoming home

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were so pleased we stayed extra days. This is a great hotel right in the heart of Evian with the most wonderful owners who couldn't do enough for us. The room was beautifully decorated in french provincial style and the bathroom had had a recent makeover. The restaurant two doors up was phenomenal and I would definately recommend Continental.
reviews.title: Fantastic place to stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My partner Janet and I stayed at the Continental from 23rd August through the 6th September. We'd asked some months previously for a lake view room and that's what we got. Don't worry if they're all taken when you reserve, as the lake itself is only three minutes stroll away.
reviews.title: Picture Perfect - Evian (Hotel Continental)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled solo
reviews.text: Lovely, charming hotel with a long history. Beautiful reception areas, and huge rooms. Lovely japanese garden on first floor. Good cafe and restaurant. Unfortunately the outside was being painted when I stayed there, and windows were blocked some of the time - otherwise there was a small balcony with views over the opera house.
reviews.title: Great Historic hotel
Sidewalk cafe
reviews.text: Most staff were excellent, but on leaving one wanted to order a taxi for us at great cost, when there was a line of them at the door for half the price!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I would probably stay there again for I prefer hotels with historic significance, and architecture. I don't like white boxes!!
reviews.title: Old world charm

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled with friends
reviews.text: While we didn't stay at the Hotel Continental, we spent part of the night at their sidewalk cafe for dinner and drinks. Old world charm right in the middle of the high end shopping district. Great place for people watching with great food and a nice assortment of cocktails. After reading their the reviews upon returning home, we would definitely stay there on our next trip.
reviews.title: Step back in Time

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hotel Continental is one of the timeless, classic structures in the heart of downtown district. Fantastic location, the hotel has a timeless charm about itself, courteous staff. The breakfast service was nice and laid out in a beautiful setting. The biggest plus point for the hotel is its absolutely central location..the downtown district is the most buzzing part of town, all the major shopping centres, museums, tourist spots, bars & restaurants are within walking distance. The hotel has also had some iconic guests like Graham Greene (who wrote the book "The Quiet American" while staying here)..so one more reason to explore this piece of history
reviews.title: Reaching into the past .....

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled with friends
reviews.text: We stayed at the hotel on Tet New Years eve and had a fantastic experience. The hotel was spotless, the rooms were huge, ornate with wood carved pillars separating the rooms and a balcony. We stayed in the Jr. suites and booked early for a discount. It was like being in the middle of Times Square, but the rooms were very quiet. Walking distance to the market, Notre Dame, and the Post Office plus very close to departure point for Saigon River Express. That evening we were invited to the New Year's eve party with drinks and food by the General Manager and had a wonderful time. We are just everyday tourists and only spent one night. This one night will be one of our life's memories because of the location, room, and hospitality shown to us on that evening.
reviews.title: Beautiful and Great Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Went with 3 friends. Love the atmosphere of this hotel. My room mate was captivated with the historical charm of our room. I love the central location. It's in the heart of all the places I love to go when I visit Saigon. The breakfast was good but had to get my coffee from Highlands over the road as I'm not fond of the coffee on offer.
reviews.title: Fabulous

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The quality of this hotel is almost beyond description.
reviews.title: Superb

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Whilst it offers all the comforts of a modern hotel, one can't help being captivated by the charm of its 1880 vintage from the time you are greeted by the immaculately dressed Bell Hops and escorted through the spacious foyer and to your room.
reviews.title: A Step into History

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013
reviews.text: After a mix up with our airport pick up we were upgraded to a Junior Suite on the first floor (Room 111) with its stunning combination of Deco and Asian furnishings.
reviews.title: Not bad!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I really like this old hotel. It's here Graham Greene wrote the Quiet American, & it's in the prime location in Saigon. The rooms are suite-sized, the staff professional & friendly, & there's a supermarket & high-end shopping centre next door. Very good coffee shops & French restaurants are walking distance nearby. The breakfast in the hotel is quite good - the Viets aren't experts on Western food, but they make a decent effort here.
reviews.title: Great historic hotel
Iconic and in great location.
reviews.text: One of the downsides of Vietnam is the amount of pests who will haggle you to go on a xic lo ride, or buy something - ignore them, as you won't get rid of them. Also, beware of bag snatchers - a Korean tourist had his camera stolen by a motorbike thief in front of the hotel. When I had my honeymoon in Saigon in 1999, the police shot the two thieves who did that, straight off their bike, but unfortunately on this occassion this thief got away.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: About 50 metres away is the Sheraton, & they have a really good disco & bar there. My girlfriend & I went there for drinks, & ended up getting invited to dance with a Viet wedding party! Souveniers along Dong Khoi St are reasonably priced, & there are some other good bars & restaurants around. We usually go to Pho 24 for our cheap meals.
reviews.title: Tired, rundown, a disappointment.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2013, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Had a wonderful stay for our last two nights in Vietnam. This is a very impressive hotel in a great location. Room 310 overlooked the front with good view of Opera house. A large room with excellent facilities. The hotel has a lot of history and interesting decor. Breakfast was fantastic and staff helpful.
reviews.title: Beautifully refurbished hotel in great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled on business
reviews.text: We had our last meal in their restaurant whilst waiting to leave for the Airport. Unfortunately we were the only customers, so had at least five staff waiting on us along with a pianist and violin player! Perhaps the hotel could do something to entice more customers to use it to give a better atmosphere. There was another restaurant in the centre courtyard serving Vietnamese food which we would have preferred but that was also empty and with no view of the street.
reviews.title: Hotel with an amazing long history

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I booked this hotel on hotels.com for £35/night after reading all the lovely reviews about it on the internet. It was advertised as having a spa and air conditioning which was really important to me due to the long walks and hot days that I expected to be having on my holiday.
reviews.title: A Budget Hotel
Hotel Continental, August holidays 2008 [in English]
reviews.text: Upon arrival, the hotel is easy to find although not very easy on the eye. We were given a very small room at the back of the hotel facing the fire escape. The room had a very small tv with no English channels and the tiniest shower I have ever seen. There was a button for air conditioning but this was switched off so we were not able to use this.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location is really good - smack in the middle of District 1, right across from the Opera House. But it is one of the oldest hotels in Saigon and it shows. Rooms are large but feels really old. AC (individual split unit) stopped blowing out cold air in the middle of our first night there and leaked water. They fixed it the next day though. Some of the bulbs/lights didn't work either. Though these were not real deal-breakers, room-wise, especially considering the relatively reasonable price in that location.
reviews.title: Good location but not in such great condition

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast area was really nice though food selection was so-so. Breakfast area staff weren't great, especially the older guys - they were grumpy and one even sneezed openly and directly in close proximity of the food while taking his breakfast (not sure how this works, personnel policy-wise, maybe he was a senior staff member)...we stopped eating after seeing this and were glad it was our last breakfast there.
reviews.title: Good location, lovely old world style

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013
reviews.text: The Continental is one of the oldest hotels in Saigon and although she is showing her age she is still quite a lovely place to stay. The location in Dist 1 is ideal for touring around and the price is very reasonable given the prices in the deluxe hotels in the area. Staff is friendly, service is good and English not a problem for the staff. Be warned though that this is only a 3 story hotel on a very busy street so street noise is an issue late in the evening and very early in the morning.Take a garden view if you want to sleep in! Have a beer on The Continental Shelf, relax and watch the world go by.
reviews.title: History and luxury in the heart of it all

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled solo
reviews.text: Stayed here two nights during the new year celebrations, and felt very spoilt. Room was huge, breakfast amazing and complimentary fruit basket was a treat. The building is beautiful. The hotel is in a great location, walking distance to everything. Very clean but smells a bit of cigarettes in hallways (rooms are fine) so be wary of that if such things tend to get to you. Overall, a really fantastic place.
reviews.title: Old Colonial Luxury

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: Old world charm at its best, very old school, it is where Greene wrote the Quiet American.
reviews.title: Old world charm with a literary history

description: Continental HotelContinental hotel is situated just a few steps from Lovere’s historical centre, at only 100 mt from lake shore, with a panoramic view on lake Iseo and Adamello’s peak.Continental Hotel is the ideal place for a relaxing holidays, with excellent services and a wonderful lake view.Staying in our hotel, guests can take advantage from many discounted offers, for example visiting lake on a ferryboat, to spend a nice day in public swimming pool, or relaxing at Terme di Boario, an important termal centre, or to visit Accademia Tadini Museum.Continental Hotel is air-conditioned, has a lift, restaurant, breakfast room, meeting room, wake-up service.Continental hotel has a new management from February 2013 and offers to its guests wifi and garage for free.How to reach usFrom Milan: autostrada A4 direction Venezia, exit Seriate, follow indication for lago d’Iseo and Lovere.From Brescia: autostrada A4 direction Milano, exit Brescia ovest, follow indication for Valla Camonica, Lago d’Iseo e then Lovere.
